When popping slows to 2 to 3 seconds, pour popcorn into a large bowl. 4. Sprinkle chili powder, cayenne, salt, and lime zest over popcorn and toss. 5. Drizzle lime juice lightly around the bowl, toss again, and serve immediately.

Description: Savory popcorn tossed with real cheddar flavor and a hint of garlic.
Ingredients: 1/2 cup popcorn kernels, air-popped. 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted. 1/3 cup cheddar cheese powder. 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder. 1/4 teaspoon paprika. 1/2 teaspoon fine salt.
Instructions: 1. Pop kernels in an air popper and place popcorn in a large bowl. 2. Drizzle melted butter over popcorn and toss to coat. 3. Sprinkle cheese powder, garlic powder, paprika, and salt evenly over popcorn. 4. Toss thoroughly until seasoning is well distributed. 5. Serve warm for best texture.

Recipe Name: Dark Chocolate Drizzle Popcorn with Sea Salt
Description: A sweet salty treat of crisp popcorn drizzled with dark chocolate.
Ingredients: 1/3 cup popcorn kernels, air-popped. 3 ounces dark chocolate 70 percent, chopped. 1 tablespoon coconut oil. 1/4 teaspoon flaky sea salt.
Instructions: 1. Spread popcorn on a parchment lined baking sheet. 2. Melt chocolate with coconut oil in a heatproof bowl over barely simmering water, stirring until smooth. 3. Drizzle melted chocolate evenly over popcorn. 4. Sprinkle with sea salt and let set at room temperature or refrigerate 10 minutes. 5. Break into clusters and serve.

Description: Soft and chewy bakery style pretzels with a deep golden crust and a sprinkle of coarse salt.
Ingredients: 4 cups all purpose flour. 1 1/2 cups warm water. 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast. 2 tablespoons granulated sugar. 1 1/2 teaspoons fine salt. 2 tablespoons unsalted butter melted. 10 cups water for boiling. 2/3 cup baking soda. 1 large egg beaten with 1 tablespoon water. 2 tablespoons coarse pretzel salt
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl combine warm water yeast and sugar. Let stand 5 minutes until foamy. 2. Stir in melted butter and salt then add flour gradually until a soft dough forms. 3. Knead 5 to 7 minutes until smooth. Place in a greased bowl cover and let rise about 60 minutes until doubled. 4. Preheat oven to 450 F and line two baking sheets with parchment. 5. Bring the water and baking soda to a gentle boil in a wide pot. 6. Divide dough into 8 pieces. Roll each into a 24 inch rope and shape into pretzels. 7. Boil each pretzel 20 to 30 seconds per side. Remove drain and place on sheets. 8. Brush with egg wash and sprinkle with coarse salt. 9. Bake 10 to 12 minutes until deep golden. Cool briefly and serve warm.

Description: Hearty soft pretzels made with a blend of whole wheat and bread flour for nutty flavor and extra fiber.
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour. 2 cups bread flour. 1 1/2 cups warm water. 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast. 2 tablespoons honey. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 1/2 teaspoons fine salt. 10 cups water for boiling. 2/3 cup baking soda. 1 large egg beaten with 1 tablespoon water. 2 tablespoons sesame seeds or coarse salt
Instructions: 1. In a bowl combine warm water yeast and honey. Let stand 5 minutes until foamy. 2. Stir in olive oil and salt then mix in both flours to form a soft dough. 3. Knead 6 to 8 minutes until smooth. Place in a greased bowl cover and rise about 60 minutes. 4. Preheat oven to 450 F and line two baking sheets with parchment. 5. Bring the water and baking soda to a gentle boil. 6. Divide dough into 8 pieces roll into 24 inch ropes and shape into pretzels. 7. Boil 20 to 30 seconds per side remove and drain. 8. Brush with egg wash and sprinkle with sesame seeds or coarse salt. 9. Bake 12 to 14 minutes until deep golden and serve warm.

Description: Soft bite sized pretzels coated in warm cinnamon sugar for a fun sweet treat.
Ingredients: 4 cups all purpose flour. 1 1/2 cups warm water. 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast. 1/4 cup granulated sugar for dough. 1 teaspoon fine salt. 2 tablespoons unsalted butter melted for dough. 10 cups water for boiling. 2/3 cup baking soda. 4 tablespoons unsalted butter melted for coating. 1/2 cup granulated sugar for coating. 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
Instructions: 1. Combine warm water yeast and dough sugar in a bowl and let stand 5 minutes. 2. Mix in melted butter and salt then add flour to form a soft dough. 3. Knead 5 to 7 minutes place in a greased bowl cover and rise about 60 minutes. 4. Preheat oven to 450 F line two baking sheets with parchment and bring the water and baking soda to a gentle boil. 5. Divide dough into 6 ropes cut each into 1 inch pieces. 6. Boil bites 20 seconds remove drain and place on sheets. 7. Bake 8 to 10 minutes until golden. 8. Toss warm bites with melted butter then with cinnamon sugar and serve.

Description: Soft pretzels filled with creamy cheddar and jalapeños for a spicy cheesy snack or light meal.
Ingredients: 4 cups all purpose flour. 1 1/2 cups warm water. 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast. 1 tablespoon granulated sugar. 1 1/2 teaspoons fine salt. 2 tablespoons unsalted butter melted. 1 1/2 cups shredded sharp cheddar. 1/3 cup diced pickled jalapeños patted dry. 4 ounces cream cheese softened. 10 cups water for boiling. 2/3 cup baking soda. 1 large egg beaten with 1 tablespoon water. 2 teaspoons coarse salt
Instructions: 1. In a bowl combine warm water yeast and sugar. Rest 5 minutes. 2. Add melted butter and salt then mix in flour to form a soft dough. 3. Knead 6 to 8 minutes place in a greased bowl cover and rise about 60 minutes. 4. In a small bowl mix cheddar jalapeños and cream cheese. 5. Preheat oven to 450 F line sheets with parchment and bring the water and baking soda to a gentle boil. 6. Divide dough into 8 pieces. Flatten each into a rectangle add filling along the center and pinch edges to seal into a rope then shape into a pretzel. 7. Boil each pretzel 20 to 30 seconds remove drain and place on sheets. 8. Brush with egg wash sprinkle with coarse salt and bake 12 to 14 minutes until deep golden. 9. Cool slightly and serve warm.

Description: Juicy hot dogs wrapped in soft pretzel dough for a fun handheld meal.
Ingredients: 3 1/2 cups all purpose flour. 1 1/4 cups warm water. 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast. 1 tablespoon granulated sugar. 1 teaspoon fine salt. 2 tablespoons unsalted butter melted. 8 beef or turkey hot dogs. 10 cups water for boiling. 2/3 cup baking soda. 1 large egg beaten with 1 tablespoon water. 1 tablespoon sesame seeds or coarse salt
Instructions: 1. Combine warm water yeast and sugar and let stand 5 minutes. 2. Stir in melted butter and salt then mix in flour to form a soft dough. 3. Knead 5 to 7 minutes place in a greased bowl cover and rise about 60 minutes. 4. Preheat oven to 450 F line two baking sheets with parchment and bring the water and baking soda to a gentle boil. 5. Divide dough into 8 pieces and roll into long ropes. 6. Pat hot dogs dry and spiral wrap each with a rope sealing the ends. 7. Boil each wrapped dog 20 seconds remove drain and place on sheets. 8. Brush with egg wash sprinkle with sesame seeds or coarse salt and bake 12 to 14 minutes until deep golden. 9. Rest 5 minutes and serve.

Description: A creamy, refreshing green smoothie packed with protein, fiber, and omega-3s.
Ingredients: 1 medium banana, peeled. 2 cups baby spinach. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. 1/2 cup plain nonfat Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon chia seeds. 1 teaspoon honey. 1 cup ice cubes.
Instructions: 1. Add banana, spinach, almond milk, Greek yogurt, chia seeds, and honey to a blender. 2. Blend on high until completely smooth. 3. Add ice and blend again until thick and frosty. 4. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.

Description: A satisfying, high-protein berry smoothie ideal for post-workout or a quick breakfast.
Ingredients: 1 cup frozen mixed berries. 1/2 medium banana, sliced. 1/4 cup rolled oats. 1 scoop vanilla whey protein powder. 1 cup 2 percent milk. 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed. 1 cup ice cubes.
Instructions: 1. Add berries, banana, oats, whey protein, milk, and flaxseed to a blender. 2. Blend until smooth and creamy. 3. Add ice and blend again to desired thickness. 4. Serve cold.

Description: A bright, tangy tropical blend with creamy yogurt and a hint of lime.
Ingredients: 1 cup diced ripe mango. 1 cup diced pineapple. 1 cup coconut water. 1/2 cup plain nonfat Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice. 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger. 1 cup ice cubes.
Instructions: 1. Place mango, pineapple, coconut water, Greek yogurt, lime juice, and ginger in a blender. 2. Blend on high until smooth. 3. Add ice and blend until frosty. 4. Pour into a chilled glass and enjoy.

Description: A rich, dessert-like smoothie with chocolate, peanut butter, and oats.
Ingredients: 1 medium banana, peeled. 2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter. 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder. 1 cup 2 percent milk. 2 tablespoons rolled oats. 1 Medjool date, pitted. 1 cup ice cubes.
Instructions: 1. Add banana, peanut butter, cocoa, milk, oats, and date to a blender. 2. Blend until smooth and chocolaty. 3. Add ice and blend to your preferred thickness. 4. Serve immediately.

Description: A zesty, probiotic-packed smoothie with peaches, kefir, and warm spices.
Ingredients: 1 cup sliced peaches, fresh or frozen. 1 small banana, sliced. 1 small carrot, chopped. 1 cup plain low-fat kefir. 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger. 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric. 1 teaspoon honey. 1 cup ice cubes.
Instructions: 1. Add peaches, banana, carrot, kefir, ginger, turmeric, and honey to a blender. 2. Blend on high until completely smooth. 3. Add ice and blend again until thick and cold. 4. Pour into a glass and drink right away.

Recipe Name: Classic Nut and Fruit Trail Mix
Description: A balanced blend of crunchy nuts, seeds, dried fruit, and a hint of dark chocolate for an anytime boost.
Ingredients: 1 cup raw almonds. 3/4 cup cashews. 1/2 cup walnut halves. 1/2 cup pumpkin seeds. 1/3 cup sunflower seeds. 3/4 cup raisins. 1/2 cup dried cranberries. 1/3 cup dark chocolate chips. 1/4 cup unsweetened coconut flakes. Pinch of fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Combine almonds, cashews, walnuts, pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, raisins, cranberries, chocolate chips, and coconut in a large bowl. 2. Sprinkle with a pinch of salt and toss well to distribute. 3. Taste and adjust sweetness or salt by adding a few more chocolate chips or a tiny pinch of salt if desired. 4. Transfer to an airtight container. 5. Store in a cool dry place for up to two weeks and portion as needed.

Description: A bright and chewy mix with coconut, mango, pineapple, and crunchy nuts that tastes like a beach getaway.
Ingredients: 3/4 cup macadamia nuts. 3/4 cup cashews. 1/2 cup almonds. 1 cup coconut chips. 3/4 cup dried pineapple pieces. 3/4 cup dried mango, chopped. 1/2 cup banana chips. 1/2 cup pumpkin seeds. Pinch of sea salt. Finely grated lime zest optional
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl combine macadamias, cashews, almonds, coconut chips, pineapple, mango, banana chips, and pumpkin seeds. 2. Add a small pinch of salt and a little lime zest if using, then toss to mix evenly. 3. Check for balance and add a few extra fruit pieces for more sweetness if desired. 4. Store in an airtight container. 5. Keep in a cool place to preserve the coconut and fruit texture.

Description: A bold, crunchy mix with roasted nuts, chickpeas, and pretzels coated in a smoky chili seasoning.
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dry roasted peanuts, unsalted. 1 cup almonds. 1/2 cup shelled pistachios. 1 cup pumpkin seeds. 1 cup roasted chickpeas. 1 cup mini pretzel twists, broken. 2 teaspoons olive oil. 2 teaspoons maple syrup. 1 teaspoon chili powder. 1 teaspoon smoked paprika. 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder. 1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. 2. In a large bowl whisk olive oil, maple syrup, chili powder, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and salt. 3. Add peanuts, almonds, pistachios, pumpkin seeds, chickpeas, and pretzels and toss until evenly coated. 4. Spread on a lined baking sheet and bake for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring once, until fragrant and dry to the touch. 5. Cool completely, then store in an airtight container.

Description: A hearty, lower sugar blend packed with plant protein from edamame, nuts, seeds, and a touch of dark chocolate.
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dry roasted edamame. 1 1/4 cups almonds. 1 cup pepitas. 3/4 cup walnut halves. 3/4 cup hazelnuts. 1/2 cup hemp hearts. 1/2 cup dried blueberries. 1/3 cup dark chocolate chunks. 3 tablespoons chia seeds. Pinch of sea salt. 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl combine edamame, almonds, pepitas, walnuts, hazelnuts, hemp hearts, blueberries, chocolate, chia seeds, and flaxseed. 2. Add a small pinch of salt and toss well. 3. Taste and adjust by adding a few more blueberries for sweetness if desired. 4. Store in an airtight container in a cool dry place. 5. Portion into snack bags for grab and go.

Recipe Name: Sweet and Salty Party Trail Mix
Description: A crowd pleasing mix of peanuts, pretzels, cereal, raisins, and chocolate that hits every craving.
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups roasted peanuts. 2 cups mini pretzels. 1 1/2 cups corn cereal squares. 1 cup raisins. 1/2 cup mini chocolate candies. 1/3 cup roasted sunflower seeds
Instructions: 1. Combine peanuts, pretzels, cereal, raisins, chocolate candies, and sunflower seeds in a large bowl. 2. Toss until evenly mixed. 3. For extra crunch add a few more pretzels if desired. 4. Store in an airtight container. 5. Keep in a cool spot to prevent chocolate from melting.

Description: Creamy chickpea dip with tahini and lemon that blends into a smooth spread for veggies or pita.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas 15 ounces drained and rinsed. 3 tablespoons tahini. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. 1 small garlic clove. 3 tablespoons water. 1 teaspoon ground cumin. 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Instructions: 1. Add chickpeas tahini lemon juice garlic cumin salt and water to a food processor. 2. Blend until mostly smooth scraping down the sides. 3. With the motor running drizzle in olive oil and blend until very creamy. 4. Taste and blend briefly again if needed to smooth. 5. Transfer to a bowl and chill 20 minutes before serving.

Description: A vibrant dip of roasted red peppers and walnuts with a hint of lemon and warm spices.
Ingredients: 2 large roasted red bell peppers peeled and seeded. 1/2 cup walnuts. 1/4 cup breadcrumbs. 1 small garlic clove. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. 1 tablespoon pomegranate molasses. 1/2 teaspoon paprika. 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin. 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Instructions: 1. Place peppers walnuts breadcrumbs garlic paprika cumin and salt in a food processor. 2. Pulse until finely chopped but not pureed. 3. Add lemon juice and pomegranate molasses. 4. With the motor running stream in olive oil and process to a slightly chunky dip. 5. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate 20 minutes to meld flavors.

Description: Silky roasted eggplant dip with tahini lemon and garlic.
Ingredients: 2 medium eggplants. 3 tablespoons tahini. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 small garlic clove. 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin. 1/4 teaspoon salt. 1 tablespoon chopped parsley.
Instructions: 1. Roast eggplants over a grill or in a 450 degree F oven until skins char and flesh is very soft. 2. Cool then split and scoop the flesh into a bowl discarding skins and excess liquid. 3. Add tahini lemon juice garlic cumin and salt and mash or process until mostly smooth. 4. Drizzle in olive oil and blend until creamy. 5. Fold in parsley and serve warm or chilled.

Recipe Name: Greek Yogurt Spinach and Artichoke Dip
Description: A lighter creamy dip packed with spinach artichokes and tangy yogurt.
Ingredients: 1 cup plain Greek yogurt 2 percent. 1 cup cooked chopped spinach squeezed dry. 1 cup canned artichoke hearts drained and chopped. 1/4 cup grated Parmesan. 2 tablespoons light cream cheese softened. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 small garlic clove minced. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. 1/4 teaspoon chili flakes. 1/4 teaspoon salt. Pinch of black pepper.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl combine yogurt spinach artichokes Parmesan cream cheese garlic lemon juice chili flakes salt and black pepper. 2. Stir until smooth and evenly mixed. 3. Warm in a small skillet over low heat with olive oil for 3 to 4 minutes stirring just until heated through. 4. Remove from heat and cool slightly. 5. Transfer to a serving bowl and chill or serve warm.

Description: A creamy green dip with avocado edamame lime and herbs for fresh flavor.
Ingredients: 1 ripe avocado peeled and pitted. 1 cup shelled edamame cooked. 2 tablespoons lime juice. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 small jalapeno seeded. 1/4 cup cilantro leaves. 1 small garlic clove. 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin. 1/4 teaspoon salt. 2 tablespoons water.
Instructions: 1. Add avocado edamame lime juice jalapeno cilantro garlic cumin salt and water to a food processor. 2. Pulse to combine then blend until smooth scraping the sides as needed. 3. With the motor running drizzle in olive oil and process until light and creamy. 4. Adjust texture with a splash of water if needed. 5. Transfer to a bowl and serve or chill.

Description: A crunchy-chewy bar loaded with oats, almonds, and cranberries, lightly sweetened with honey and bound with almond butter.
Ingredients: 3 cups rolled oats. 1 cup chopped almonds. 1/2 cup dried cranberries. 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed. 1/2 cup honey. 1/2 cup almond butter. 2 tablespoons coconut oil. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon. 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 325 F and line an 8 by 12 inch pan with parchment. 2. Spread oats and almonds on a sheet pan and toast 8 to 10 minutes until fragrant, then cool slightly. 3. In a small pot over low heat, warm honey, almond butter, and coconut oil, stirring until smooth, then remove from heat and stir in vanilla, cinnamon, and salt. 4. In a large bowl, combine oats, almonds, cranberries, and flaxseed. Pour in the warm mixture and stir until evenly coated. 5. Press firmly into the prepared pan, bake 15 to 18 minutes until lightly golden, cool completely, then lift out and slice into bars.

Recipe Name: No-Bake Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Granola Bars
Description: Soft and chewy no-bake bars packed with peanut butter, oats, and chocolate chips.
Ingredients: 2 1/2 cups rolled oats. 3/4 cup natural peanut butter. 1/3 cup honey. 1/2 cup mini dark chocolate chips. 1/2 cup chopped peanuts. 2 tablespoons chia seeds. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Line an 8 by 8 inch pan with parchment, leaving overhang for easy lifting. 2. In a small saucepan over low heat, warm peanut butter and honey until loose and glossy, then remove from heat and stir in vanilla and salt. 3. In a large bowl, combine oats, peanuts, and chia seeds. Pour over the warm mixture and stir until evenly moistened. 4. Let the mixture cool for 5 minutes, then fold in chocolate chips. 5. Press very firmly into the pan, chill 1 hour to set, then lift out and cut into bars.

Description: A vibrant, nutty bar studded with tart cranberries and pistachios, lightly sweetened with maple syrup.
Ingredients: 2 3/4 cups rolled oats. 3/4 cup shelled pistachios, chopped. 1/3 cup pumpkin seeds. 2/3 cup dried cranberries. 1/3 cup unsweetened shredded coconut. 1/2 cup pure maple syrup. 2 tablespoons coconut oil. 1 tablespoon chia seeds. 1 teaspoon orange zest. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 325 F and line a 9 by 9 inch pan with parchment. 2. Toast oats, pistachios, and coconut on a sheet pan for 8 minutes, then cool slightly. 3. In a small saucepan, warm maple syrup and coconut oil just until melted, then stir in vanilla, orange zest, and salt. 4. In a large bowl, combine oats mixture with cranberries, pumpkin seeds, and chia. Pour in the syrup mixture and stir until evenly coated. 5. Press firmly into the pan, bake 15 to 18 minutes, cool completely, then slice into bars.

Description: Savory-sweet sesame and tahini bars with a toasty crunch and maple-kissed chew.
Ingredients: 2 1/2 cups rolled oats. 2/3 cup tahini. 1/3 cup pure maple syrup. 1/3 cup sesame seeds. 1/2 cup sunflower seeds. 1/2 cup chopped dates. 1 tablespoon coconut oil. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon. 1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Line a 9 by 9 inch pan with parchment. 2. In a small saucepan, warm tahini, maple syrup, and coconut oil over low heat until smooth, then stir in vanilla, cinnamon, and salt. 3. In a large bowl, combine oats, sesame seeds, sunflower seeds, and dates. 4. Pour in the tahini mixture and stir until everything is evenly coated. 5. Press the mixture firmly into the pan, chill 1 to 2 hours until set, then cut into bars.

Description: Soft, naturally sweet bars made with ripe bananas, oats, walnuts, and raisins for an energy-boosting snack.
Ingredients: 2 1/2 cups rolled oats. 2 large ripe bananas, mashed. 3/4 cup chopped walnuts. 1/2 cup raisins. 1/3 cup almond butter. 2 tablespoons honey. 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed. 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 325 F and line a 9 by 9 inch pan with parchment. 2. In a bowl, stir together mashed bananas, almond butter, honey, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt until smooth. 3. Add oats, walnuts, raisins, and flaxseed, and mix until evenly combined. 4. Press firmly into the pan and smooth the top. 5. Bake 20 to 25 minutes until set and lightly golden, cool completely, then slice.

Description: Crunchy oven roasted almonds with a light smoky paprika and sea salt finish.
Ingredients: 2 cups raw almonds. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 teaspoon fine sea salt. 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 F. 2. In a bowl combine almonds olive oil salt and smoked paprika until evenly coated. 3. Spread almonds on a parchment lined baking sheet in a single layer. 4. Roast for 12 to 15 minutes stirring once halfway until fragrant and lightly browned. 5. Remove from the oven and let cool on the pan to crisp up. 6. Store in an airtight container once completely cool.

Description: Toasty pecans coated in a warm maple cinnamon glaze for a sweet and crunchy treat.
Ingredients: 2 cups pecan halves. 2 tablespoons maple syrup. 1 tablespoon unsalted butter melted. 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon. 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 F. 2. In a bowl toss pecans with maple syrup melted butter cinnamon and salt until evenly coated. 3. Spread on a parchment lined baking sheet in a single layer. 4. Roast for 12 to 15 minutes stirring once to prevent scorching. 5. Cool completely on the pan to set the glaze. 6. Store in an airtight container.

Description: Zesty and slightly spicy cashews with bright lime and chili flavors.
Ingredients: 2 cups raw cashews. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 tablespoon lime juice. 1 teaspoon chili powder. 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper. 3/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 F. 2. In a bowl combine cashews olive oil lime juice chili powder cayenne and salt until coated. 3. Spread on a parchment lined baking sheet in a single layer. 4. Roast for 12 to 15 minutes stirring once until golden and fragrant. 5. Let cool completely on the pan. 6. Store in an airtight container.

Description: Savory aromatic mixed nuts infused with rosemary and garlic for an herby crunch.
Ingredients: 2 cups unsalted mixed nuts. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh rosemary. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. 3/4 teaspoon fine sea salt. 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 F. 2. Toss mixed nuts with olive oil rosemary garlic powder salt and pepper until evenly coated. 3. Spread on a parchment lined baking sheet in a single layer. 4. Roast for 12 to 15 minutes stirring once until lightly browned. 5. Cool completely on the pan to crisp. 6. Store in an airtight container.

Description: Rich and bittersweet hazelnuts dusted with cocoa and espresso for a gourmet snack.
Ingredients: 2 cups raw hazelnuts. 1 tablespoon coconut oil melted. 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder. 1 tablespoon espresso powder. 2 tablespoons powdered sugar. 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 F. 2. In a bowl toss hazelnuts with melted coconut oil cocoa powder espresso powder powdered sugar and salt until coated. 3. Spread on a parchment lined baking sheet in a single layer. 4. Roast for 10 to 12 minutes stirring once until fragrant and lightly toasted. 5. Cool completely on the pan before serving or storing. 6. Store in an airtight container.

Description: A bright, all-fruit snack with a soft chew and concentrated strawberry flavor.
Ingredients: 4 cups hulled strawberries. 2 tablespoons honey. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 175 degrees Fahrenheit and line a large rimmed baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment. 2. Blend strawberries, honey, lemon juice, and vanilla until completely smooth. 3. Optional simmer the puree in a saucepan over low heat for 5 to 8 minutes to slightly thicken, stirring often. 4. Pour onto the prepared sheet and spread evenly to about one eighth inch thick, leaving a small border. 5. Bake until the surface is dry to the touch with no wet spots, about 3 to 4 hours, rotating the pan halfway. 6. Cool 10 minutes, peel the leather from the liner, and transfer to a cutting board. 7. Cut into strips, roll with parchment if desired, and store airtight.

Description: Tropical and tangy fruit leather with a fragrant mango base and bright passion fruit.
Ingredients: 3 large ripe mangoes, flesh only. 2 passion fruit, pulp only or 1 third cup pulp. 1 tablespoon lime juice. 1 tablespoon honey.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 175 degrees Fahrenheit and line a rimmed baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment. 2. Blend mango, passion fruit pulp, lime juice, and honey until silky smooth. 3. Optional simmer over low heat for 5 minutes to reduce bubbles. 4. Spread the puree in a thin even layer about one eighth inch thick on the prepared sheet. 5. Bake 3 to 4 hours until set, dry on top, and no longer sticky, rotating the pan once. 6. Cool briefly, peel off in one sheet, and place on a cutting board. 7. Slice into strips and roll or cut into squares for storage.

Description: Cozy spiced apple leather with gentle sweetness and a hint of warm cinnamon.
Ingredients: 5 medium apples, peeled and cored. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. 2 tablespoons maple syrup. 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 175 degrees Fahrenheit and line a rimmed baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment. 2. Chop apples and cook in a covered saucepan over medium heat with lemon juice until soft, about 10 minutes. 3. Blend the cooked apples with maple syrup and cinnamon until smooth. 4. Return to the pot and simmer 5 minutes to thicken slightly, stirring often. 5. Spread evenly on the prepared sheet about one eighth inch thick. 6. Bake 3 to 4 hours until dry to the touch with no wet patches. 7. Cool, peel, and cut into strips, then store airtight.

Description: A deeply colored berry blend fortified with chia for extra body and fiber.
Ingredients: 3 cups mixed berries such as strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, and blackberries. 1 ripe banana. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. 1 tablespoon honey. 1 tablespoon chia seeds.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 175 degrees Fahrenheit and line a rimmed baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment. 2. Blend berries, banana, lemon juice, honey, and chia seeds until very smooth. 3. Rest the puree 5 minutes to let chia slightly thicken it. 4. Spread evenly to about one eighth inch thickness on the prepared sheet. 5. Bake 3 to 4 hours until the surface is dry and leathery, rotating the pan as needed. 6. Let cool briefly, peel off the liner, and move to a cutting board. 7. Slice into strips and roll, then store in an airtight container.

Description: Sweet peach leather with a gentle kick of fresh ginger and citrus brightness.
Ingredients: 5 ripe peaches, peeled and pitted. 2 teaspoons grated fresh ginger. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. 1 tablespoon granulated sugar. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 175 degrees Fahrenheit and line a rimmed baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment. 2. Blend peaches, ginger, lemon juice, sugar, and vanilla until completely smooth. 3. Optional simmer over low heat 5 minutes to slightly reduce. 4. Spread puree evenly to about one eighth inch thick on the prepared sheet. 5. Bake 3 to 4 hours until set and no longer sticky to the touch. 6. Cool 10 minutes, peel off in one piece, and place on a cutting board. 7. Cut into strips or squares and store airtight.

Description: A light and crispy snack that highlights the natural flavor of kale with a simple salty crunch.
Ingredients: 1 large bunch kale, about 200 g, stems removed and leaves torn. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt. 1/8 teaspoon black pepper.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 300°F or 150°C and line two baking sheets with parchment. 2. Wash and dry the kale thoroughly, remove thick stems, and tear leaves into large pieces. 3. In a large bowl toss kale with olive oil, salt, and pepper until evenly coated. 4. Spread in a single layer on the baking sheets with space between leaves. 5. Bake 15 to 20 minutes until crisp and just golden at the edges, rotate pans halfway, then cool 5 minutes before serving.

Description: Savory, cheesy chips with gentle garlic warmth and a delicate crunch.
Ingredients: 1 large bunch kale, about 200 g, stems removed and leaves torn. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 2 tablespoons finely grated Parmesan cheese. 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder. 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 300°F or 150°C and line two baking sheets with parchment. 2. Wash and dry kale thoroughly, remove thick stems, and tear leaves into large pieces. 3. Toss kale with olive oil, garlic powder, and salt until lightly coated. 4. Arrange in a single layer on sheets and bake 12 minutes. 5. Sprinkle Parmesan evenly over the kale and bake 3 to 5 minutes more until crisp, then cool briefly before serving.

Description: Zesty chips with bright lime and a smoky chili kick for a bold, crunchy snack.
Ingredients: 1 large bunch kale, about 200 g, stems removed and leaves torn. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice. 1 teaspoon chili powder. 1/4 teaspoon paprika. 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 300°F or 150°C and line two baking sheets with parchment. 2. Dry the kale very well after washing, remove thick stems, and tear leaves into large pieces. 3. Whisk olive oil, lime juice, chili powder, paprika, and salt, then toss with kale to coat. 4. Spread kale in a single layer on sheets. 5. Bake 15 to 20 minutes until crisp and edges are lightly browned, rotating pans halfway, then cool before serving.

Description: Umami rich chips with toasty sesame and a whisper of soy for deep savory flavor.
Ingredients: 1 large bunch kale, about 200 g, stems removed and leaves torn. 1 tablespoon sesame oil. 1 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce. 1 teaspoon rice vinegar. 1 tablespoon sesame seeds.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 300°F or 150°C and line two baking sheets with parchment. 2. Wash and dry kale thoroughly, remove thick stems, and tear leaves into large pieces. 3. Whisk sesame oil, soy sauce, and rice vinegar, then toss with kale to coat evenly. 4. Spread kale on sheets in a single layer and sprinkle with sesame seeds. 5. Bake 15 to 18 minutes until crisp, rotate pans halfway, then cool before serving.

Description: Crunchy, savory chips coated in everything bagel seasoning with a cheesy boost from nutritional yeast.
Ingredients: 1 large bunch kale, about 200 g, stems removed and leaves torn. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 2 teaspoons everything bagel seasoning. 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 300°F or 150°C and line two baking sheets with parchment. 2. Wash and dry kale thoroughly, remove thick stems, and tear leaves into large pieces. 3. Toss kale with olive oil, everything bagel seasoning, and nutritional yeast until evenly coated. 4. Arrange in a single layer on the baking sheets. 5. Bake 15 to 20 minutes until crisp and lightly golden, rotate pans halfway, then cool before serving.
